meanings.definition: The process of dividing a region or group into smaller, often hostile units.
meanings.sent1: The balkanizations of the once united community led to conflicts and misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: The balkanizations within the political party weakened its overall strength.
meanings.sent3: The balkanizations at the family reunion over who gets the last piece of cake were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The balkanizations in the classroom turned friends into rivals overnight.
meanings.sent5: The balkanizations of the company into separate departments made collaboration difficult.

meanings.definition: The act of creating divisions or factions within a larger entity.
meanings.sent1: His constant gossiping resulted in the balkanizations of the once close-knit group.
meanings.sent2: The balkanizations caused by the disagreement over the project's direction were hard to mend.
meanings.sent3: The balkanizations in the office cafeteria line due to food preferences were quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The balkanizations in the music industry created fierce competition among artists.
meanings.sent5: The balkanizations in the online gaming community led to intense rivalries.
